titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Guide to the Milton Irwin Roemer Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Diane Kaplan

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 9, 2019 at 09:12

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers include correspondence, writings, topical files, and photographs, which document Milton Roemer's career as a health administrator, a professor of public health, and an advocate for national health insurance. The papers also highlight Roemer's work for the World Health Organization and the Saskatchewan Department of Public Health and include material concerning his loyalty case. These papers form part of the Contemporary Medical Care and Health Policy Collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Milton Irwin Roemer, 1998. The papers were received following his death in 2001.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Milton Irwin Roemer Papers (MS 1786). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Milton Irwin Roemer was born in Patterson, New Jersey and earned his bachelor's degree in public health from the University of Michigan. He also studied sociology at Cornell University and received a medical degree from New York University. Roemer, an advocate for government supported health programs and health maintenance organizations, held positions in health administration with the United States Public Health Service, the World Health Organization, and the Saskatchewan Department of Public Health. He also taught at Yale University and the University of California Los Angeles. Roemer died on January 3, 2001.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers include correspondence, writings, topical files, and photographs, which document Milton Roemer's career as a health administrator, a professor of public health, and an advocate for national health insurance. The papers also highlight Roemer's work for the World Health Organization and the Saskatchewan Department of Public Health and include material concerning his loyalty case. These papers form part of the Contemporary Medical Care and Health Policy Collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers are arranged as received. Office files represent those materials maintained by Roemer in his office at the University of California, Los Angeles, while Home files are those found in the Roemer home. Of particular note are the yearly files, which consist of correspondence, writings, and other materials that document the progression of Roemer's work and interests through his entire professional career.
